name: Roasted Edamame Salad
headline: Roasted Edamame Salad

image.description:

keywords: Easy Side Dish Recipes,Side Dish,Easy Lunch Recipes,Lunch,Salad Recipes,Beans and Legumes,Edamame Recipes,Roasting,Gluten Free,High Fiber,Vegan
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces fresh or frozen shelled edamame, about 2 cups
1/2 cup fresh corn kernels, about 2 ears of corn

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

Place the edamame, corn, scallion, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper into a 13 by 9 metal pan and stir to combine. Place on the middle rack of the oven and roast for 10 to 15 minutes, just until the edamame begins to brown. Remove from the oven and place in the refrigerator until completely cool, approximately 30 minutes.
Add the tomato, basil and vinegar to the edamame mixture and toss to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning, as desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

review.reviewBody: Delicious and healthy
The perfect side to bring to a summer cookout. Easy. Fresh. Delicious.
Loved it!! Yum !!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this. I tripled this recipe and made it for a work food day - it's amazing. I had to roast longer than the time given in the recipe, and I used rice vinegar (my red wine vinegar was empty). I've already been asked for the recipe and it's not lunch time. I will be making this a lot, so satisfying.

Yum! It sounds deceptively basic but it is really satisfying and flavorful. I wondered, as others seemed to, if just red wine vinegar could be enough. Turns out it is good even without added vinegar. I made some brown jasmine rice to go with it. I put some leftover balsamic Dijon vinegarette on the rice only with this salad on top. Everyone loved it. The roasting really does the trick. I had to roast it a little longer to get any browning. I used red pepper to start but added roasted cherry tomatoes a few days later. Both really good! Don’t skip the fresh basil. - adds a lot. Can’t wait to make it again.

While the edamame is roasting and cooling off, I marinate the tomatoes and basil in the vinegar with salt. I have even left it overnight, which gives the tomatoes such a wonderful flavor!

This is one of my favorite all-time recipes, we make it a lot, have some in the fridge right now. It keeps really well and you can make it in advance for a party, or even to have as a snack.
Delicious. I cooked the veggies in a skillet rather than the oven, and added more vinegar & garlic. The basil was the special flavor that made it pop.

Oh YUMMY! Changes I made: Cooked it in a skillet instead of roasting, used red pepper instead of tomato (cooked with the edamame in the skillet), no black pepper, used 1 T home-dried basil instead of the fresh (went in the skillet too), and used lemon juice instead of vinegar. This is sooo delicious!

Read more at: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/alton-brown/roasted-edamame-salad-recipe.html#sni-reviews?oc=linkback
Delicious.  Have to say, I was skeptical since there is pretty much no "dressing" on this, just red wine vinegar, but Y-U-M!  New summer side dish fave!
The flavors blended together beautifully.  This is an excellent side dish that even pleased my picky husband!
Another excellent Alton recipe.  Simple and delicious.  We had ours at room temp. Would be great to take to a picnic/cookout/bbq.
Delicious! I omitted the vinegar & tomato and used a fresh tomato vinaigrette. LOVE it!
Absolutely delicious, and healthy. Not often you find that combination.  Thanks AB.
delicious, easy, healthy, and pretty! I'll probably have a bowl constantly in my fridge. I think any type of vinegar would be tasty and a little different: balsamic, rice, red wine....
This is a GREAT recipe!  I have made it SO many times and it continues to be a huge hit.  I also add cut up red bell peppers.  THIS RECIPE IS A KEEPER!!
My son ate the entire bowl in one sitting. I added red pepper to the roasted mixture. It was quite yummy.

I made this and took it to a couple of vegan friends of mine, and they loved it! They told me they "scarfed it down" and that they wanted the recipe. Even their non-vegan relatives loved it. I have made it a couple of times since then, because it's so good. In fact, I'm preparing it for a potluck tonight.

I like adding extra corn, using all the kernels from two big ears of corn (and a little extra vinegar for the extra volume of veggies.

This recipe should be tagged "vegan", so it could be found more easily by people looking for vegan recipes.

This is really, really good. I think I could eat this stuff every day. Would be great on top of a green salad, too.

The only change I made was I used a good quality balsamic vinegar in place of the red wine......just because I thought it would better suit my tastes.......and I didn't have freah basil so I rehydrated a little dried basil and added a little fresh minced flat-leaf parsley.

I probably added a little more olive oil and vinegar and garlic than the recipe called for..just did it to my tastes. I love it!!!!

Next time, I think I might try adding some black beans (in place of the corn. A little feta cheese would be great sprinkled over top for some added color and texture. A winner in my book!!
Easy to make, outstanding recipe! It's healthy, delicious, and colorful. This will be one of my staple recipes - great for snacking!
Great way to eat edamame! I was scared to try this but I love edamame and also love roasting veggies so had to try it. Easy side dish!

SO, SO DELICIOUS, healthy and easy! I was skeptical about the flavor of this dish considering that it uses so few ingredients but it tasted AMAZING! I roasted half of the tomatoes in the oven with the edamame & corn to enrich the taste then used the remainder at the end to freshen it up & give the dish a bit of acid. Worked out great. I will definitely make this again!!
This salad is soooo good and healthy to boot.  The flavors combine wonderfully.

SO TASTY!  What a fresh tasting yummy salad, even the young kids loved it.  I did sub balsamic vinegar and a bit more garlic because I like more garlic.  Next time I will add some goat cheese or feta just to change it up.  Definitely make ahead of time and let marinate for a couple of hours.  Wonderful and so healthy!
Yum-eeee.

Used frozen edamame - after I roasted it I realized I needed to shuckk the beans out of the pods. LOL Ended up roasting them again because all the flavor was on the pods. :(

The flavor is great, tho! Served with a bit of crumbled feta and some torn up chicken lunch meat. Back for seconds I think! LOL

Loved it!  We've been buying prepared edamame salad at Publix, but I made it myself, and saved lots of $$, and I can tweak the recipe to change things up!  The basil in my garden is too small, so I used fresh parsley and oregano from my garden, and substituted balsamic vinegar for the red wine vinegar. I only had canned w.k. corn, so in it went. A definite keeper and new family fave, and it really is better the next day!

Not sure if it's fair to review the recipe given the number of modifications I made, but here goes. To make it a vegetarian entree, I added a cup of cooked farro, added lots more basil (I have a ton in my garden right now), subbed an onion for the scallions (didn't have any) and used about 2T balsamic and 2T wine vinegar.  Also, used both the tomatoes as in original recipe and some diced red pepper roasted with the edamame mixture as suggested by others. The balsamic gave it a bit of sweetness that I liked. I served it with grilled asparagus. It was delicious and filling and I will make it again.

Very good. Followed suggestion of adding red pepper. I roasted it with the edamame and corn mixture.  Thought it could have used just a little more vinegar. Definitely a keeper! Alton comes through again.

I substituted the fresh basil with a generous handful of chopped fresh parsley, because fresh basil is crazy expensive this time of year. This salad was great, and I'll definitely make it again.  I served it as a side dish with baked salmon, but I think it could easily be a meal in and of itself.

this is delicious!! I made it according to the recipe first and that was delicious, and since then I've made a few more batches with a few substitutions-- red bell pepper is great in place of the tomato, and balsamic vinegar is delicious in place of the red wine vinegar. Thanks Alton!!
Made one substitution using diced red bell pepper instead of the tomatoes, which tend to get soggy if the salad is made ahead. Everyone I've made it for has had positive comments, thus far.

I'm a vegetarian in a house full of meat eaters and everyone in the family gobbled it up. Got the recipe from  a previous reviewer and have shared it with several other friends. Everyone is delighted with the simplicity and great flavors!!!  I added a few more cloves of garlic and two extra ears of corn. LOVE IT!!! Thanks Alton

I had this bag of edamame in my freezer for months but didn't know what to do w/ it.  This recipe looked good and I had the ingredients so I tried it - I substituted 1/2 a small sweet onion as I don't like scallions, and added a very light sprinkling of red pepper flakes.  It's really good when first made, but let it sit in the fridge for a day or two, and OH, MAMMA!  It's fantastic!
We made this as a side dish for grilled burgers. Yummy!

Was very excited after reading the reviews. This dish seemed to need time to set up, was much better after a couple of hours in the fridge. I did all the veggies on the grill, too hot in Florida for the oven. I added grilled asparagus and red peppers to the mix and some lemon. I felt like I had to add more salt that the recipe called for to season it, but the blandness did seem to go away after it sat in the fridge for awhile.  I think some feta crumbles would go a long way in this dish, and maybe some red pepper flakes. Overall, a good dish that you can feel good about eating.
I use cilantro instead of basil, and leave out the red wine vinegar and substitute hot chili oil. Makes it even better

Oh yum.  It was great the first time, even better with a couple tablespoons of crumbled feta stirred in...make sure you don't use frozen corn.  Only fresh cobs with the corn cut off stayed super crispy!

This salad is quick to make, and is absolutely delicious! I keep a few bags of frozen shelled edamame bags in my freezer at all times, just for this salad.

Edamame, and basil work quite well together.
thanks, AB...that was fantastic...my son loved it as well....fantastic textures and very colorful to the eye...will be a hit at next potluck, for sure....and oh, so healthy as well....

... And asked for more! Love you Alton!
This salad is delicious just as the recipe is written. Anything that gets my 3 year old to eat a vegetable and ASK FOR MORE is tops in my book. Currently roasting my second batch for the week. We've been eating it as a side dish at dinner all week.
I will certainly be makinmg this again...and again!
I eat this dish as a meal, as a side, on salad, on my burgers & also mix it in with tortellini & olive oil salad dressing!
Alton rules in all matters of cooking IMHO. So I think this recipe would have benefitted from a really good homegrown or heirloom tomato. So health and delicious, also pretty. Thank you AB.

I'm a big Alton Brown fan.... and being a vegetarian, I always have been eyes open for his recipes that I can have as well, since I know I won't be disappointed! This is probably my favorite of all his recipes. Delicious! but in a good way.... like you don't expect it to be that good. Very healthy and yumm!!
http://onestopeats.wordpress.com/2009/07/29/alton-browns-edamame-salad/

I did made this recipe as a side dish for dinner tonight.  I used the same recipe but did a stir-fry instead of roasting it (I can't imagine using the oven during a hot and humid summer day).  Came out delicious!  I will be making it again; thanks Alton!
Made as directed and enjoyed this with dinner.

Following his pattern of providing different and amazing items...this one is no exception. As others have mentioned . it's easy to make and oh so delicious! I didn't/wouldn't change a thing except perhaps doubling the recipe just to make sure there are leftovers as I am sure this would be great the next day too!

I had something similar to this in a restaurant, so I was hoping to find a recipe on FN. I was thrilled to see this by Alton Brown. He's proven himself yet again with this one. It was so wonderful and healthy! We just had it by itself (no recipe tweaking required), but next time I'm going to serve cedar plank scallops on top!
I'm not a health food nut, but this kind of salad I can really get behind.

This is five star rating all the way..so much flavor its like a party in your mouth! Simple and easy with frozen edamame, its a crowd pleaser for sure. Don't hesitate to make this receipe, you won't regret it.

This is my new favorite dish to eat.  I'm new to edamame, having first used it in a South Beach version of Shepherd's Pie.  But this recipe has everything I love in it...edamame, tomatoes, corn, basil and the touch of red wine vinegar brings it all together!  Thanks, Alton.  Another great dish!

I love roasted vegies and I love edamame, so this was a no brainer to try. I loved it!  It was flavorful, light tasting, and very healthy. I could easily eat this several  times a week and not get tired of it. My next dinner party will have this on the menu. Good job Alton Brown.

I keep this salad in my fridge all the time now! It is the perfect healthy snack or quick meal. It is so easy to make, very affordable, and very flavorful! It is one of my new favorite dishes, and turns out great every time I make it.

I adore Alton Brown and every single one of his recipes I have tried are simply delicious!  I saw this episode and decided to make it.  I've always been a lover of edamame, but I've only had it the traditional way in the pods and salted. Also, try it w/a fresh cilantro substitution for the fresh basil... yummy!

I'm always on the lookout for new vegan dishes.  This was so easy to make, so delicious, and so healthy.  I made this for dinner last night and threw in a little chili oil along with the olive oil.  My husband and I both loved this, we'll be making it often!

Being born and raised in the Argentine "Pampas" (and a steak cook and eater for most of my adult life), I would have a great deal of trouble chosing between a wonderful juicy mouth-watering steak and this beyong-veggie heavenly recipe. This great salad is easy to make, super-tasteful (color and flavor) and at under $3.00 to feed 4 people, it certainly beats the hell out of steak. I must confess that I was so "overtaken" by the nutiness, that I cheated and added one more ingredient (sorry Alton) - toasted pignoli....man, I love my edamame!

This is a fantastic recipe - so easy to prepare and completely delicious. This is one of those rare instances where something is really healthy and really good at the same time. I was also very glad to learn from the episode that edamame are complete proteins. I can't wait to rock my vegan friends' worlds by making this for them - but it is so good that non-vegetarian friends will also be impressed.

thanks for another great episode and recipe!
Wonderful salad.  Was skeptical at first because of absence of spices, but salad had a fresh flavor and I love the edamame.  I had never tried it before.
This tasted great, and was easy to make. Made a great meatless main dish.

video.name: Roasted Edamame Salad
video.description: Roasted edamame, corn, tomatoes: this delicious salad is a meal in a bowl.
